title: The phytopathogen
authors: Song K, Li R, Cui Y, Chen B, Zhou L, Han W, Jiang BL, He YW
abstract: Salicylic acid (SA) plays an essential role in plant defense against biotrophic and semi-biotrophic pathogens. Following pathogen recognition, SA biosynthesis dramatically increases at the infection site of the host plant. The manner in which pathogens sense and tolerate the onslaught of SA stress to survive in the plant following infection remains to be understood. The objective of this work was to determine how the model phytopathogen
